metadata.title: CVE-2018-16086 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in extensions API in Google Chrome prior to69.0.3497.81 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install amalicious extension to bypass navigation restrictions via a crafted ChromeExtension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16086` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
